short_text: The Surah takes its name al-Mulk from the very first sentence.
text:
The Surah takes its name al-Mulk from the very first sentence.

Period of Revelation

It could not be known from any authentic tradition when this Surah was revealed, but the subject matter and the style indicate that it is one of the earliest Surahs to be revealed at Makkah.

Theme and Subject Matter

In this surah, on the one hand, the teachings of Islam have been introduced briefly, and, on the other, the people living in heedlessness have been aroused from their slumber in a most effective way. A characteristic of the earliest surahs of the Makkan period is that they present the entire teachings of Islam and the object of the Holy Prophet's mission, not in detail, but briefly, so that they are assimilated by the people easily. Moreover, they are particularly directed to make the people shun heedlessness, to make them think, and to arouse their dormant conscience.

In the first five verses man has been made to realize that the universe in which he lives is a most well organized and fortified Kingdom in which he cannot detect any fault, any weakness or flaw, how ever hard he may try to probe. This Kingdom has been brought from nothing into existence by Allah Almighty Himself and All the powers of controlling, administering and ruling it are also entirely in Allah's hand and His power is infinite. Besides, man has also been told that in this wise system he has not been created without a purpose, but he has been sent here for a test and in this test he can succeed only by his righteous deeds and conduct.

In vv. 6-11, dreadful consequences of disbelief which will appear in the Hereafter have been mentioned, and the people told that Allah, by sending His Prophets, has warned them of these consequences in this very world, as if to say "Now, if you do not believe in what the Prophets say and correct your attitude and behavior accordingly, in the Hereafter you will yourself have to admit that you really deserved the punishment that was being meted out to you."

In vv. 12-15, the truth that has been impressed on the minds is that the Creator cannot be unaware of His creation, as if to say: "He is aware of each open and hidden secret of yours, even of the innermost ideas of your hearts. Hence, the right basis of morality is that man should avoid evil, fearing the accountability of the unseen God, whether in the world there is a power to take him to task for this or not, and whether in the world there is a possibility of being harmed by such a power or not. Those who adopt such a conduct in the world alone will deserve forgiveness and a rich reward in the Hereafter."

In vv. 15-23, making allusions, one after the other to those common truths of daily occurrence, which man does not regard as worthy of much attention, he has been invited to consider them seriously. It has been said: "Look: the earth on which you move about with full satisfaction and peace of mind, and from which you obtain your sustenance has been subdued for you by Allah; otherwise this earth might at any time start shaking suddenly so as to cause your destruction, or a typhoon might occur, which may annihilate you completely. Look at the birds that fly above you; it is only Allah Who is sustaining them in the air. Look at your own means and resources: if Allah wills to inflict you with a scourge, none can save you from it; and if Allah wills to close the doors of sustenance on you, none can open them for you. These things are there to make you aware of the truth, but you see them like animals, which are unable to draw conclusions from observations, and you do not use your
sight, hearing and minds which Allah has bestowed on you as men; that is why you do not see the right way."

In vv. 24-27, it has been said: "You have ultimately to appear before your God in any case. It is not for the Prophet to tell you the exact time and date of the event. His only duty is to warn you beforehand of its inevitable occurrence. Today you do not listen to him and demand that he should cause the event to occur and appear prematurely before you; but when it does occur, and you see it with your own eyes, you will then be astounded. Then, it will be said to you "This is the very thing you were calling to be hastened."

In vv. 28-29 replies have been given to what the disbelievers of Makkah said against the Holy Prophet (upon whom be peace) and his Companions. They cursed the Holy Prophet and prayed for his and the believers destruction. To this it has been said: "Whether those who call you to the right way are destroyed, or shown mercy by Allah, how will their fate change your destiny? You should look after yourselves and consider who would save you if you were overtaken by the scourge of God?You regard those who believe in God and put their trust in Him as the misguided. A time will come when it will become evident as to who was misguided in actual truth.

In conclusion, the people have been asked this question and left to ponder over it "If the water which has come out from the earth at some place in the desert or hill country of Arabia and upon which depends your whole life activity, should sink and vanish underground, who beside Allah can restore to you this life giving water?"
description: The surah that opens with the statement “Blessed is He in whose hands is all sovereignty”. It takes its name from Divine sovereignty (mulk) mentioned in verse 1. The surah challenges the disbelievers with declarations of God’s total power over them, and everything else, in this world and the next. It describes the regret the disbelievers will express on the Day of Resurrection (verse 9 . and verse 27).The surah is also known as: Control, The Dominion, The Kingdom.

Efendi Nahi.verse 67:1: Eshtë i lartësuar Ai, në dorën e të cilit është pushteti dhe Ai është i pushtetshëm për çdo gjë! –
Efendi Nahi.verse 67:2: Ai i cili ka krijur jetën dhe vdekjen, për t’ju provuar se kush prej jush vepron më mirë; - Ai është i Plotëfuqishëm dhe falës.
Efendi Nahi.verse 67:3: Ai, i cili, i ka krijuar shtatë qiej njërin mbi tjetrin, - ti nuk vëren në krijesat e Mëshiruesit kurrfarë disharmonie, dhe shiko edhe një ehrë a mos po sheh ndonjë plasaritje,
Efendi Nahi.verse 67:4: pastaj shiko përsëri shumë herë, shikimi do të kthehet i lodhur dhe i molisuar.
Efendi Nahi.verse 67:5: Na, juve ua kemi zbukuruar qiellin më të afërm me yje të shkëlqyeshme dhe kemi bërë që (zjarri i tyre) t’i gjuajë djajtë, për të cilët kemi përgatitur dënimin me zjarr.
Efendi Nahi.verse 67:6: Kurse, për ata që nuk besojnë në Zotin e tyre, dënimi është skëterra; e sa i shëmtuar është ai vendbanim!
Efendi Nahi.verse 67:7: Kur të hudhen në të, do të dëgjohet psherëtima e tyre, e zjarri do të ndizet furishëm,
Efendi Nahi.verse 67:8: gati për të eksploduar nga ashpërsia. Kurdo që të hedhet në të ndonjë grup (jobesimtarësh), - rojtarët e skëterrës i pyesin ata: “A nuk u erdhi askush t’ua tërheq vërejtjen juve?”
Efendi Nahi.verse 67:9: “Po”, përgjigjen ata, gjithsesi na ka ardhur neve përkujtuesi, por ne i kemi mohuar ata dhe kemi thënë: “Perëndia nuk ka shpallur asgjë, ju jeni në humbje të madhe!”
Efendi Nahi.verse 67:10: Ata (jobesimtarët), thonë: “Sikur të kishim dëgjuar ose menduar, nuk do të gjendeshim midis banorëve të skëterrës!”
Efendi Nahi.verse 67:11: Dhe, ata e pranuan mëkatin e tyre. Larg qofshin prej mëshirës së Zotit banorët e skëterrës!
Efendi Nahi.verse 67:12: Me të vërtetë, ata që i frikohen Zotit të tyre edhe atëherë kur nuk i sheh askush, për ta ka falje dhe shpërblim të madh!
Efendi Nahi.verse 67:13: Flitni ju fshehtas ose haptas, por Ai, me të vërtetë, di çka në zemrat tuaja!
Efendi Nahi.verse 67:14: E si mos t’i dijë Ai, i cili ka krijuar çdo gjë dhe është i informuar hollësisht.
Efendi Nahi.verse 67:15: Ai ju ka bërë Tokën të nënshtruar – të shërbyeshme, andaj ecni nëpër viset e saj dhe ushqehuni me atë që ju ka dhënë Ai. Ju (pasi të ringjalleni), do të ktheheni tek Ai.
Efendi Nahi.verse 67:16: A jeni ju të sigurtë se Ai që është (Sundues) në qiell, nuk do t’ju fusë në tokë, kur ajo fillon të dridhet papritmas?
Efendi Nahi.verse 67:17: Ose, a jeni të sigurtë se Ai që është (Sundues) në qiell, nuk do t’ju çojë furtunë gurësh? Atëherë do të dini se çfarë është vërejtja Ime!
Efendi Nahi.verse 67:18: Me të vërtetë, i kanë konsideruar gënjeshtarë ata që kanë qenë përpara këtyre. E sa i ashpër ka qenë dënimi (pezmi) Im!
Efendi Nahi.verse 67:19: A thua nuk po i shohin ata shpendët mbi kokat e tyre, se si fluturojnë, duke i hapur dhe mbledhur krahët? Askush nuk i mbanë ata, përveç Zotit Mëshirues; Ai, me të vërtetë, sheh çdo gjë.
Efendi Nahi.verse 67:20: Ose, kush është ai që do të jetë ushtria e juaj, që t’u ndihmojë juve, përveç Mëshiruesit? Jobesimtarët janë vetëm në mashtrim, (s’ka ushtarë për ju).
Efendi Nahi.verse 67:21: Kush janë ata që ju furnizojnë, në qoftë se Ai (Perëndia) e ndalon furnizimin? – Por, ata janë zhytur në të këqia dhe në arrati (nga e vërteta).
Efendi Nahi.verse 67:22: Eshtë më mirë ai që shkon rrëshqanas e kokëulur, apo ai që në rrugën e drejtë ecën vertikalisht e ballëlartë?
Efendi Nahi.verse 67:23: Thuaj: “Ai është që ju ka krijur dhe u ka dhënë të dëgjuarit, të pamurit dhe zemrat (mendjen), kurse ju pak falenderoni!”
Efendi Nahi.verse 67:24: Thuaj: “Ai ju ka krijuar të shpërndarë nëpër Tokë dhe para Tij do të tuboheni (për llogari)”.
Efendi Nahi.verse 67:25: E ata thonë: “Kur është ky premtim (caktojeni), nëse thoni të vërtetën?!”
Efendi Nahi.verse 67:26: Thuaj: “Vetëm Zoti e di (kohën), kurse unë jam vetëm paralajmërues i qartë”.
Efendi Nahi.verse 67:27: Kur për së afërmi e panë dënimin, u zymtuan fytyrat e atyre që nuk kanë besuar dhe do t’u thuhet: “Qe, kjo është ajo që e keni kërkuar (shpejtimin e dënimit)!”
Efendi Nahi.verse 67:28: Thuaj: “C’menoni ju, në qoftë se Perëndia më shkatërron mua dhe ata që janë me mua, ose na mëshiron; kush është ai që do t’i mbrojë jobesimtarët nga dënimi i padurueshëm?”
Efendi Nahi.verse 67:29: Thuaj: “Ai është Mëshiruesi, (që na shpëton neve), në Atë besojmë dhe në Atë mbështetemi, e ju sigurisht do ta dini se kush është i humbur plotësisht”.
Efendi Nahi.verse 67:30: Thuaj: “Cka mendoni, nëse ujërat tuaja ju shterren – kush do t’u sjell juve ujin rrjedhës?”

null.verse 67:1: Hökm (hər şeyin ixtiyarı) əlində olan Allah nə qədər ucadır (nə qədər uludur). O, hər şeyə qadirdir!
null.verse 67:2: Hansınızın əməlcə daha gözəl olduğunu sınamaq (bəlli etmək) üçün ölümü və həyatı yaradan Odur. O, yenilməz qüvvət sahibidir, (çox) bağışlayandır.
null.verse 67:3: Yeddi göyü (bir-birinin üstündə) qat-qat yaradan da Odur. (Ey insan!) Sən Rəhmanın yaratdığında heç bir uyğunsuzluq görməzsən. Bir gözünü qaldırıb (səmaya) bax, heç orada bir yarıq (çatdaq, nöqsan) görə bilərsənmi?!
null.verse 67:4: Sonra gözünü qaldırıb iki dəfə bax. Göz orada (axtardığını tapmayıb) zəif, yorğun düşərək yenə də sənə tərəf qayıdacaqdır!
null.verse 67:5: And olsun ki, Biz dünya səmasını (yerə ən yaxın olan göyü) qəndillərlə (ulduzlarla) bəzədik, onları şeytanlara atılan mərmilər etdik və onlar (şeytanlar) üçün yandırıb-yaxan alovlu atəş əzabı hazırladıq.
null.verse 67:6: Rəbbini inkar edənləri cəhənnəm əzabı gözləyir. Ora necə də pis məskəndir!
null.verse 67:7: Onlar (özləri kimi kafirlərlə) qaynayan Cəhənnəmə atıldıqları zaman onun dəhşətli uğultusunu eşidəcəklər!
null.verse 67:8: O, (kafirlərə olan) qeyzindən az qala parça-parça olsun. Hər hansı bir tayfa ora (Cəhənnəmə) atıldıqca onun gözətçiləri onlardan (məzəmmətlə): "Məgər sizə (Allahın əzabı ilə) qorxudan bir peyğəmbər gəlməmişdimi?" - deyə soruşacaqlar.
null.verse 67:9: Onlar deyəcəklər: "Bəli, bizə (Allahın əzabı ilə) qorxudan peyğəmbər gəlmişdi. Amma biz (onu) yalançı sayıb demişdik: "Allah heç bir şey (vəhy) nazil etməmişdir. Siz sadəcə olaraq (haqdan) çox azmısınız!"
null.verse 67:10: Onlar: "Əgər biz (peyğəmbərlərin öyüd-nəsihətinə) qulaq asıb ağlımızı başımıza yığsaydıq, cəhənnəm əhli içində olmazdıq!" - deyəcək,
null.verse 67:11: Və beləcə öz günahlarını e'tiraf edəcəklər. Məhv olsun cəhənnəm əhli!
null.verse 67:12: Rəbbindən (Onu) görmədən qorxanları isə (günahlardan) bağışlanma və böyük bir mükafat gözləyir!
null.verse 67:13: (Ey insanlar!) İstər sözünüzü gizli saxlayın, istər açıq deyin (heç bir fərqi yoxdur). (Allah) ürəklərdə olanları biləndir!
null.verse 67:14: Məgər yaradan (sizin gizli saxladığınız hər şeyi) bilməzmi?! O, (hər şeyi) incəliyinə qədər biləndir, (hər şeydən) xəbərdardır!
null.verse 67:15: Yeri (Yer kürəsini) sizə ram edən Odur. Onun qoynunda gəzin, (Allahın) ruzisindən yeyin. Axır dönüş də Onadır!
null.verse 67:16: (Ey insanlar!) Göydə olanın (Allahın) yer hərəkətə gəlib çalxalandığı zaman sizi onun dibinə batırmayacağına əminsinizmi?!
null.verse 67:17: Yaxud göydə olanın sizin üstünüzə daş yağdıran bir yel göndərməyəcəyinə arxayınsınızmı?! Onda Mənim (sizi əzabla) qorxutmağımın necə olduğunu mütləq biləcəksiniz.
null.verse 67:18: Onlardan (Məkkə mürşiklərindən) əvvəlkilər də (öz peyğəmbərlərini) təkzib etmişdilər. (Ya Peyğəmbər! Bir görəydin) Mənim onları cəzalandırmağım (inkar etməyim) necə oldu.
null.verse 67:19: Məgər onlar başları üstündə (səf çəkib) qanad çalaraq (qanadlarını açıb-yumaraq) uçan quşları görmürlərmi? Onları (göydə) ancaq Rəhman (olan Allah) saxlayır. Həqiqətən, O, hər şeyi görəndir!
null.verse 67:20: Yaxud bu əsgərləriniz (köməkçiləriniz) kimdir ki, onlar sizi Rəhmanın əzabından qurtara bilsinlər?! (Bəndələri Allahın əzabından Onun ?zündən başqa heç kəs xilas edə bilməz!) Kafirlər, sadəcə olaraq, aldanmaqdadırlar!
null.verse 67:21: Əgər (Allah) ?z ruzisini kəssə, sizə kim ruzi verə bilər?! Xeyr onlar (cahillikləri üzündən) dikbaşlıqdan və (haqqa) nifrət etməkdən (boyun qoymamaqdan) əl çəkmirlər.
null.verse 67:22: Elə isə (küfrü ucbatından) üzüstə sürünən daha haqq yoldadır, yoxsa düz yolda düz gedən?!
null.verse 67:23: (Ya Peyğəmbər!) De: "Sizi yoxdan yaradan, sizə qulaq, göz və qəlb verən Odur. (Allahın ne'mətlərinə) nə az şükür edirsiniz!"
null.verse 67:24: De: "Sizi yer üzünə yayıb səpələyən Odur. (Qiyamət günü) Onun hüzuruna toplanacaqsınız!"
null.verse 67:25: Onlar (müşriklər) deyirlər: "Əgər doğru danışanlardansınızsa, (bir xəbər verin görək) bu və'd (haqq-hesab, cəza) nə vaxt yerinə yetəcəkdir?"
null.verse 67:26: De: "Onu bilmək yalnız Allaha məxsusdur. Mən isə ancaq (sizi Allahın əzabı ilə) açıq-aşkar qorxudan bir peyğəmbərəm!"
null.verse 67:27: Kafirlər əzabın yaxınlaşdığını gördükləri zaman üzləri eybəcər kökə düşəcək (qaralacaq) və onlara: "Sizin (dünyada) istədiyiniz (və həmişə istehza edib inanmadığınız) əzab budur!" - deyiləcəkdir.
null.verse 67:28: (Ya Peyğəmbər! Bu müşriklərə) de: "Bir deyin görək, istər Allah məni və mənimlə birlikdə olanları məhv etsin, istərsə də bizə bir mərhəmət əta etsin; siz kafirləri şiddətli əzabdan (Allahın əzabından) kim qurtara bilər?! (Biz ölsək də, qalsaq da, bu sizə heç bir fayda verməz. Allahın əzabından nicat tapmaq üçün ancaq Onun haqq dininə iman gətirmək lazımdır!)
null.verse 67:29: De: "O bizim iman gətirdiyimiz və təvəkkül etdiyimiz Rəhmandır. Kimin (haqq yoldan) açıq-aydın azmış olduğunu (tezliklə) biləcəksiniz!"
null.verse 67:30: De: "Bir söyləyin görək, əgər suyunuz çəkilib (yerin dibinə) getsə, (Allahdan başqa) kim sizə axar su gətirə bilər?!

null.verse 67:1: Uzvišen je Onaj u čijoj je ruci vlast - On sve može! -
null.verse 67:2: Onaj koji je dao smrt i život da bi iskušao koji od vas će bolje postupati; -
null.verse 67:3: Onaj koji je sedam nebesa jedna iznad drugih stvorio - ti u onome što Milostivi stvara ne vidiš nikakva nesklada, pa ponovo pogledaj vidiš li ikakav nedostatak,
null.verse 67:4: zatim ponovo više puta pogledaj, pogled će ti se vratiti klonuo i umoran.
null.verse 67:5: Mi smo vama najbliže nebo sjajnim zvijezdama ukrasili i učinili da vatra iz njih pogađa šejtane, za koje smo patnju u ognju pripremili.
null.verse 67:6: A za one koji ne vjeruju u Gospodara svoga kazna je Džehennem, užasno je ono boravište!
null.verse 67:7: Kad budu u nj bačeni, pucketanje njegovo će čuti, i on će ključati,
null.verse 67:8: gotovo da se od bijesa raspadne. Kad god se koja gomila u nj baci, stražari u njemu će je upitati: "Zar nije niko dolazio da vas opominje?"
null.verse 67:9: Jest, dolazio nam je onaj koji nas je opominjao - odgovoriće -
null.verse 67:10: I reći će: "Da smo slušali ili razmišljali, ne bismo među stanovnicima Džehennema bili!"
null.verse 67:11: I oni će priznati da su bili nevjernici - pa, stanovnici Džehennema ognjenog daleko bili!"
null.verse 67:12: Onima koji se Gospodara svoga boje i kad ih niko ne vidi - oprost i nagrada velika!
null.verse 67:13: Govorili vi tiho ili glasno - pa, On, sigurno, zna svačije misli!
null.verse 67:14: A kako i ne bi znao Onaj koji stvara, Onaj koji sve potanko zna, koji je o svemu obaviješten.
null.verse 67:15: On vam je Zemlju pogodnom učinio, pa hodajte predjelima njezinim i hranite se onim što On daje, Njemu ćete poslije oživljenja odgovarati.
null.verse 67:16: Jeste li sigurni da vas Onaj koji nebesima vlada neće u Zemlju utjerati, kad se ona počne iznenada tresti?
null.verse 67:17: Ili, jeste li sigurni da Onaj koji nebesima vlada na vas neće vjetar s kamenjem poslati? Tada biste saznali kakva je prijetnja Moja!
null.verse 67:18: A poricali su i oni prije njih, pa kakva je samo bila kazna Moja!
null.verse 67:19: Zar oni ne vide ptice iznad sebe kako raširenih krila lete, a i skupljaju ih? Samo ih Milostivi drži; On, zaista, sve dobro vidi.
null.verse 67:20: Ili ko je taj koji će biti vojska vaša i vama pomoći, osim Milostivog? - Nevjernici su samo obmanuti.
null.verse 67:21: Ili, ko je taj koji će vas nahraniti, ako On hranu Svoju uskrati? - Ali, oni su uporni u bahatosti i u bježanju od istine.
null.verse 67:22: Da li je na ispravnijem putu onaj koji se idući spotiče ili onaj koji Pravim putem uspravno ide?
null.verse 67:23: Reci:"On sve stvara i daje vam sluh i vid i pameti, a vi se malo zahvaljujete!"
null.verse 67:24: Reci:"On vas je po Zemlji razasuo i pred Njim ćete se sakupiti."
null.verse 67:25: A oni govore:"Kad će već jednom ta prijetnja, ako istinu govorite?!"
null.verse 67:26: Reci:"Sam Allah zna! A ja sam dužan samo da javno opominjem."
null.verse 67:27: Kad je izbliza ugledaju, jad će prekriti lica onih koji nisu vjerovali i biće rečeno:"Evo, ovo je ono što ste požurivali!"
null.verse 67:28: Reci:"Kažite vi meni: ako Allah pošalje smrt meni i onima koji su sa mnom, ili ako nam se smiluje, ko će nevjernike od neizdržljive patnje zaštititi?"
null.verse 67:29: Reci:"On je Milostivi, u Njega vjerujemo i na Njega se oslanjamo, a vi ćete, sigurno, saznati ko je u očitoj zabludi."
null.verse 67:30: Reci:"Šta mislite, ako vam vode presuše - ko će vam tekuću vodu dati?"

null.verse 67:1: পূণ্যময় তিনি, যাঁর হাতে রাজত্ব। তিনি সবকিছুর উপর সর্বশক্তিমান।
null.verse 67:2: যিনি সৃষ্টি করেছেন মরণ ও জীবন, যাতে তোমাদেরকে পরীক্ষা করেন-কে তোমাদের মধ্যে কর্মে শ্রেষ্ঠ? তিনি পরাক্রমশালী, ক্ষমাময়।
null.verse 67:3: তিনি সপ্ত আকাশ স্তরে স্তরে সৃষ্টি করেছেন। তুমি করুণাময় আল্লাহ তা’আলার সৃষ্টিতে কোন তফাত দেখতে পাবে না। আবার দৃষ্টিফেরাও; কোন ফাটল দেখতে পাও কি?
null.verse 67:4: অতঃপর তুমি বার বার তাকিয়ে দেখ-তোমার দৃষ্টি ব্যর্থ ও পরিশ্রান্ত হয়ে তোমার দিকে ফিরে আসবে।
null.verse 67:5: আমি সর্বনিম্ন আকাশকে প্রদীপমালা দ্বারা সুসজ্জত করেছি; সেগুলোকে শয়তানদের জন্যে ক্ষেপণাস্ত্রবৎ করেছি এবং প্রস্তুত করে রেখেছি তাদের জন্যে জলন্ত অগ্নির শাস্তি।
null.verse 67:6: যারা তাদের পালনকর্তাকে অস্বীকার করেছে তাদের জন্যে রয়েছে জাহান্নামের শাস্তি। সেটা কতই না নিকৃষ্ট স্থান।
null.verse 67:7: যখন তারা তথায় নিক্ষিপ্ত হবে, তখন তার উৎক্ষিপ্ত গর্জন শুনতে পাবে।
null.verse 67:8: ক্রোধে জাহান্নাম যেন ফেটে পড়বে। যখনই তাতে কোন সম্প্রদায় নিক্ষিপ্ত হবে তখন তাদেরকে তার সিপাহীরা জিজ্ঞাসা করবে। তোমাদের কাছে কি কোন সতর্ককারী আগমন করেনি?
null.verse 67:9: তারা বলবেঃ হ্যাঁ আমাদের কাছে সতর্ককারী আগমন করেছিল, অতঃপর আমরা মিথ্যারোপ করেছিলাম এবং বলেছিলামঃ আল্লাহ তা’আলা কোন কিছু নাজিল করেননি। তোমরা মহাবিভ্রান্তিতে পড়ে রয়েছ।
null.verse 67:10: তারা আরও বলবেঃ যদি আমরা শুনতাম অথবা বুদ্ধি খাটাতাম, তবে আমরা জাহান্নামবাসীদের মধ্যে থাকতাম না।
null.verse 67:11: অতঃপর তারা তাদের অপরাধ স্বীকার করবে। জাহান্নামীরা দূর হোক।
null.verse 67:12: নিশ্চয় যারা তাদের পালনকর্তাকে না দেখে ভয় করে, তাদের জন্যে রয়েছে ক্ষমা ও মহাপুরস্কার।
null.verse 67:13: তোমরা তোমাদের কথা গোপনে বল অথবা প্রকাশ্যে বল, তিনি তো অন্তরের বিষয়াদি সম্পর্কে সম্যক অবগত।
null.verse 67:14: যিনি সৃষ্টি করেছেন, তিনি কি করে জানবেন না? তিনি সূক্ষ্নজ্ঞানী, সম্যক জ্ঞাত।
null.verse 67:15: তিনি তোমাদের জন্যে পৃথিবীকে সুগম করেছেন, অতএব, তোমরা তার কাঁধে বিচরণ কর এবং তাঁর দেয়া রিযিক আহার কর। তাঁরই কাছে পুনরুজ্জীবন হবে।
null.verse 67:16: তোমরা কি ভাবনামুক্ত হয়ে গেছ যে, আকাশে যিনি আছেন তিনি তোমাদেরকে ভূগর্ভে বিলীন করে দেবেন, অতঃপর তা কাঁপতে থাকবে।
null.verse 67:17: না তোমরা নিশ্চিন্ত হয়ে গেছ যে, আকাশে যিনি আছেন, তিনি তোমাদের উপর প্রস্তর বৃষ্টি বর্ষণ করবেন, অতঃপর তোমরা জানতে পারবে কেমন ছিল আমার সতর্কবাণী।
null.verse 67:18: তাদের পূর্ববর্তীরা মিথ্যারোপ করেছিল, অতঃপর কত কঠোর হয়েছিল আমার অস্বীকৃতি।
null.verse 67:19: তারা কি লক্ষ্য করে না, তাদের মাথার উপর উড়ন্ত পক্ষীকুলের প্রতি পাখা বিস্তারকারী ও পাখা সংকোচনকারী? রহমান আল্লাহ-ই তাদেরকে স্থির রাখেন। তিনি সর্ব-বিষয় দেখেন।
null.verse 67:20: রহমান আল্লাহ তা’আলা ব্যতীত তোমাদের কোন সৈন্য আছে কি, যে তোমাদেরকে সাহায্য করবে? কাফেররা বিভ্রান্তিতেই পতিত আছে।
null.verse 67:21: তিনি যদি রিযিক বন্ধ করে দেন, তবে কে আছে, যে তোমাদেরকে রিযিক দিবে বরং তারা অবাধ্যতা ও বিমুখতায় ডুবে রয়েছে।
null.verse 67:22: যে ব্যক্তি উপুড় হয়ে মুখে ভর দিয়ে চলে, সে-ই কি সৎ পথে চলে, না সে ব্যক্তি যে সোজা হয়ে সরলপথে চলে?
null.verse 67:23: বলুন, তিনিই তোমাদেরকে সৃষ্টি করেছেন এবং দিয়েছেন কর্ণ, চক্ষু ও অন্তর। তোমরা অল্পই কৃতজ্ঞতা প্রকাশ কর।
null.verse 67:24: বলুন, তিনিই তোমাদেরকে পৃথিবীতে বিস্তৃত করেছেন এবং তাঁরই কাছে তোমরা সমবেত হবে।
null.verse 67:25: কাফেররা বলেঃ এই প্রতিশ্রুতি কবে হবে, যদি তোমরা সত্যবাদী হও?
null.verse 67:26: বলুন, এর জ্ঞান আল্লাহ তা’আলার কাছেই আছে। আমি তো কেবল প্রকাশ্য সতর্ককারী।
null.verse 67:27: যখন তারা সেই প্রতিশ্রুতিকে আসন্ন দেখবে তখন কাফেরদের মুখমন্ডল মলিন হয়ে পড়বে এবং বলা হবেঃ এটাই তো তোমরা চাইতে।
null.verse 67:28: বলুন, তোমরা কি ভেবে দেখেছ-যদি আল্লাহ তা’আলা আমাকে ও আমার সংগীদেরকে ধ্বংস করেন অথবা আমাদের প্রতি দয়া করেন, তবে কাফেরদেরকে কে যন্ত্রণাদায়ক শাস্তি থেকে রক্ষা করবে?
null.verse 67:29: বলুন, তিনি পরম করুণাময়, আমরা তাতে বিশ্বাস রাখি এবং তাঁরই উপর ভরসা করি। সত্ত্বরই তোমরা জানতে পারবে, কে প্রকাশ্য পথ-ভ্রষ্টতায় আছে।
null.verse 67:30: বলুন, তোমরা ভেবে দেখেছ কি, যদি তোমাদের পানি ভূগর্ভের গভীরে চলে যায়, তবে কে তোমাদেরকে সরবরাহ করবে পানির স্রোতধারা?

Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 67:1: Благословен е Онзи, в Чиято Ръка е Владението. Той над всяко нещо има сила.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 67:2: Той е, Който сътвори смъртта и живота, за да ви изпита кой от вас е по-добър в делата. Той е Всемогъщия, Опрощаващия,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 67:3: Който сътвори седем небеса на слоеве. Не ще видиш несъразмерност в творението на Всемилостивия. Пак обърни взор! Нима виждаш пукнатини?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 67:4: После пак обърни взор веднъж и още веднъж. Взорът ще се върне към теб безсилен и морен.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 67:5: И украсихме най-близкото небе със светилници, и ги сторихме да бъдат камъни за сатаните. И приготвихме за тях мъчението на Пламъците.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 67:6: За онези, които не вярват в своя Господ, е мъчението на Ада. И как лоша е тази участ!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 67:7: Когато бъдат хвърлени там, ще чуят неговия рев, както ври,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 67:8: едва не избухва от ярост. Всякога, щом в него бъде хвърлена тълпа, стражите му ги питат: Не дойде ли при вас предупредител?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 67:9: Ще казват: Да, наистина, дойде при нас предупредител, но [го] взехме за лъжец и казахме: Аллах нищо не е низпослал. Вие сте в голяма заблуда.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 67:10: И ще кажат: Ако се бяхме вслушали или размислили, нямаше да сме сред обитателите на Пламъците.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 67:11: И така ще признаят своя грях. Гибел за обитателите на Пламъците!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 67:12: За онези, които и в уединение се боят от своя Господ, наистина има опрощение и голяма награда.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 67:13: Тайно или открито да изричате думите си, Той знае съкровеното в сърцата.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 67:14: Нима Онзи, Който е сътворил, не знае? Той е Всепроникващия, Сведущия.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 67:15: Той е, Който подчини за вас земята, затова ходете из нейните краища и яжте от Неговото препитание! Към Него е възкресението.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 67:16: Нима имате сигурност, че Онзи, Който е на небето, не ще накара земята да ви погълне? И ето я - тресе се!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 67:17: Или имате сигурност, че Онзи, Който е на небето, не ще изпрати срещу вас ураган от камъни, та да разберете какво е Моето предупреждение?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 67:18: И онези преди тях отричаха. А какво бе Моето наказание!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 67:19: Не виждат ли те птиците над тях, разтварящи и свиващи криле? Държи ги само Всемилостивия. Той съзира всяко нещо.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 67:20: И кое ваше войнство ще ви помогне без Всемилостивия? Неверниците само се мамят.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 67:21: Или кой може препитание да ви даде, ако Той задържи Своето препитание? Ала упорстват в надменността и отдалечаването [от истината].
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 67:22: Нима онзи, който върви с наведена глава, е по-напътен от онзи, който върви изправен по правия път?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 67:23: Кажи [о, Мухаммад]: Той е, Който ви сътвори и създаде за вас слуха и зрението, и сърцата. Колко малко сте признателни!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 67:24: Кажи: Той е, Който ви намножи по земята и при Него ще бъдете събрани.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 67:25: И казват: Кога [ще се сбъдне] това обещание, ако говорите истината?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 67:26: Кажи: Знанието е само при Аллах, а аз съм само явен предупредител.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 67:27: И когато го видят отблизо, лицата на неверниците ще помръкнат и ще им бъде казано: Това е, което търсехте.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 67:28: Кажи: Виждате ли? Дори Аллах да погуби мен и тези с мен, или да ни пощади, кой ще защити неверниците от болезненото мъчение?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 67:29: Кажи: Той е Всемилостивия. Вярваме в Него и на Него се уповаваме. И ще узнаете кой е в явна заблуда.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 67:30: Кажи: Виждате ли? Ако водата ви потъне, кой ще ви даде изворна вода?

null.verse 67:1: 多福哉擁有主權者！他對於萬事是全能的。
null.verse 67:2: 他曾創造了死生，以便他考驗你們誰的作為是最優美的。他是萬能的，是至赦的。
null.verse 67:3: 他創造了七層天，你在至仁主的所造物中，不能看出一點參差。你再看看！你究竟能看出甚麼缺陷呢？
null.verse 67:4: 然後你再看兩次，你的眼睛將昏花地、疲倦地轉回來！
null.verse 67:5: 我確已以眾星點綴最近的天，並以眾星供惡魔們猜測。我已為他們預備火獄的刑罰。
null.verse 67:6: 不信主的人們將受火獄的刑罰，那歸宿真惡劣！
null.verse 67:7: 當他們被投入火獄的時候，他們將聽見沸騰的火獄發出驢鳴般的聲音。
null.verse 67:8: 火獄幾乎為憤怒而破碎，每有一群人被投入其中，管火獄的天神們就對他們說：「難道沒有任何警告者降臨你們嗎？」
null.verse 67:9: 他們說：「不然！警告者確已降臨我們了，但我們否認他們，我們說：『真主沒有降示甚麼，你們只在重大的迷誤中。』」
null.verse 67:10: 他們說：「假若我們能聽從，或能明理，我們必不致淪於火獄的居民之列！」
null.verse 67:11: 他們承認他們的罪過。讓火獄的居民遠離真主的慈恩！
null.verse 67:12: 在秘密中畏懼主的人們，將蒙赦宥和重大的報酬。
null.verse 67:13: 你們可以隱匿你們的言語；也可以把它說出來。他確是全知心事的。
null.verse 67:14: 創造者既是玄妙而且徹知的，難道他不知道你們所隱匿的言語嗎？
null.verse 67:15: 他為你們而使大地平穩，你們應當在大地的各方行走，應當吃他的給養，你們復活後，只歸於他。
null.verse 67:16: 難道你們不怕在天上的主使大地在震蕩的時候吞咽你們嗎？
null.verse 67:17: 道你們不怕在天上的主使飛沙走石的暴風摧毀你們嗎？你們將知道我的警告是怎樣的。
null.verse 67:18: 在他們之前逝去的人們，確已否認眾使者，我的譴責是怎樣的？
null.verse 67:19: 道他們沒有看見在他們的上面展翅和歛翼的眾鳥嗎？只有至仁主維持它們，他確是明察萬物的。
null.verse 67:20: 除了真主援助你們外，還有誰能做你們的援軍呢？你們只陷於自欺之中。
null.verse 67:21: 誰能供給你們呢？如果至仁主扣留他的給養。不然，他們固執著驕傲和勃逆。
null.verse 67:22: 究竟誰更能獲得引導呢？是匍匐而行的人呢？還是在正路上挺身而行的人呢？
null.verse 67:23: 你說：「他是創造你們，並為你們創造耳、目和心的。你們卻很少感謝。」
null.verse 67:24: 你說：「他是使你們繁殖於大地上的，你們將來要被集合到他那裡。」
null.verse 67:25: 他們說：「這個警告甚麼時候實現呢？如果你們是誠實的人。」
null.verse 67:26: 你說：「關於此事的知識，只在主那裡，我只是一個坦率的警告者。」
null.verse 67:27: 當他們看見這應許臨近的時候，不信的人們的面目將變成黑的！或者將說：「這就是你們生前妄言不會實現的事。」
null.verse 67:28: 你說：「你們告訴我吧，如果真主毀滅我，和我的同道，或憐憫我們，那末，誰使不信道的人們得免於痛苦的刑罰呢？」
null.verse 67:29: 你說：「他是至仁主，我們已信仰他，我們只信賴他。你們將知道誰在明顯的迷誤中。」
null.verse 67:30: 你說：「你們告訴我吧，如果你們的水一旦滲漏了，誰能給你們一條流水呢？」

null.verse 67:1: Požehnán buď ten, v jehož rukou je království a jenž všemocný je nad každou věcí,
null.verse 67:2: jenž stvořil smrt i život, aby vyzkoušel, kdo z vás bude v skutcích nejlepší - a On mocný je i odpouštějící -
null.verse 67:3: jenž stvořil sedm nebes ve vrstvách. A nespatříš ve stvoření Milosrdného nesouměrnost žádnou! Pozvedni jen zrak svůj, zda uvidíš trhlinu nějakou!
null.verse 67:4: A potom obrať svůj zrak ještě dvakrát, a pohled tvůj se k tobě navrátí ponížen a vyčerpán námahou marnou.
null.verse 67:5: My věru jsme ozdobili nejbližší nebe svítilnami, jež určili jsme i pro satanů kamenováni, a připravili jsme pro ně trest plamenný.
null.verse 67:6: Těm, kdož neuvěřili v Pána svého, náleží trest pekelný a jak hnusný je to cíl konečný!
null.verse 67:7: A až tam vrháni budou, uslyší řev jeho, vřením vydávaný,
null.verse 67:8: a div že nevybuchne zuřivostí. A pokaždé když doň jedna skupina bude házena, zeptají se strážci jeho: "Což nepřišel k vám varovatel žádný?"
null.verse 67:9: A odpovědí: "Ano, přišel k nám varovatel, ale za lháře jsme jej prohlásili a řekli: "Bůh vůbec nic neseslal a vy jste jenom ve velkém bludu!"
null.verse 67:10: A dodají: "Kdybychom byli naslouchali či pochopili, nebyli bychom dnes věru plamene obyvateli!"
null.verse 67:11: Svou vinu tedy doznali - pryč s plamene obyvateli!
null.verse 67:12: Těm, kdo bojí se Pána svého kvůli nepoznatelnému, těm věru dostane se odpuštění i převeliké odměny.
null.verse 67:13: Utajujte si řeči své či dávejte je najevo co skryto je v hrudích, On dobře ví!
null.verse 67:14: Což nezná On ty, které stvořil, On, jenž prozíravý je a dobře zpravený?
null.verse 67:15: On je ten, jenž pro vás zemi pokornou učinil; choďte po zádech jejích a jezte z toho, co vám uštědřil a u Něho bude pak vzkříšeni.
null.verse 67:16: Jste si jisti tím, že ten, kdo na nebi dlí, vás nedá pohltit zemí? Hle, ona se již chví!
null.verse 67:17: Jste si jisti tím, že ten, kdo na nebi dlí, na vás nepošle vichřici plnou kamení? Pak poznáte, co znamená Mé varování!
null.verse 67:18: Již ti, kdo před nimi byli, posly za lháře prohlásili. A jaká byla Má nevole?
null.verse 67:19: Což neviděli ptactvo nad sebou, jak křídla roztahuje a skládá? Nikdo krom Milosrdného je nedrží a On jasně všechny věci zří.
null.verse 67:20: A kdo je ten, jenž pro vás vojskem je, aby vám pomohl, leda Milosrdný? Však nevěřící jsou jen v zaslepení.
null.verse 67:21: A kdo je ten, jenž obživu vaši vám uštědří, jestliže On štědrost svou zadrží? Však naopak oni setrvávají ve vzpurnosti a odmítání!
null.verse 67:22: Což ten, jenž klopýtá padaje na tvář svou, je veden lépe než ten, kdo vzpřímeně po stezce přímé kráčí?
null.verse 67:23: Rci: "On je ten, kdo vzniknout vám dal a daroval vám sluch, zrak i srdce - a jak málo jste vděčni!"
null.verse 67:24: Rci: "On je ten, kdo rozšířil vás po zemi - a k Němu budete shromážděni."
null.verse 67:25: A ptají se: "A kdy se tento slib splní, jste-li pravdomluvní?"
null.verse 67:26: Odpověz: "Vědomost o tom je u Boha jedině - já jsem jen varovatel zjevný."
null.verse 67:27: A až zblízka trest uvidí, naplní se tváře těch, kdož nevěřili, hrůzou; a bude jim řečeno: "Tohle je to, co jste požadovali!"
null.verse 67:28: Rci: "Co si myslíte? A ať již Bůh mě zahubí spolu s těmi, kdož se mnou jsou, anebo se nad námi slituje, kdo potom ochrání nevěřící před trestem bolestným?"
null.verse 67:29: Rci: "On je Milosrdný; uvěřili jsme v Něho a spoléháme na Něho. A záhy se dozvíte, kdo vlastně v bludu zjevném se nalézá!"
null.verse 67:30: Rci: "Co si myslíte? Kdyby se jednou zrána vody vaše v hloubce ztratily, kdo tedy, ne-li Bůh, vodu pramenitou vám dá?"

null.verse 67:1: Gezegend is Hij in Wiens hand het Koninkrijk is en Die macht heeft over alle dingen.
null.verse 67:2: Die de dood en het leven heeft ingesteld, opdat Hij u moge beproeven wie onder u zich het beste gedraagt; en Hij is de Almachtige, de Vergevensgezinde.
null.verse 67:3: Hij Die de zeven hemelen opeenvolgend heeft geschapen. Gij kunt geen tekort zien in de schepping van de Barmhartige. Kijk dan nog eens; ziet gij een enkel gebrek?
null.verse 67:4: Kijk dan weer eens en dan nog eens, uw blik zal vermoeid en verzwakt tot u terugkeren.
null.verse 67:5: En voorwaar, Wij hebben de naastbije hemel met lampen versierd, Wij hebben hem tot een middel gemaakt om de satans te verdrijven en voor hen hebben Wij de straf van het razende Vuur bereid.
null.verse 67:6: En voor degenen die niet in hun Heer geloven is de straf der hel (bereid), en dit is een slechte bestemming.
null.verse 67:7: Wanneer zij er in worden geworpen, zullen zij haar van woede horen zieden.
null.verse 67:8: Zij zal bijna barsten van woede. Telkens als een groep er in geworpen wordt, zullen de bewakers er van (der hel) hun vragen: "Kwam er geen waarschuwer tot u?"
null.verse 67:9: Zij zullen zeggen: "Zeker, de waarschuwer kwam tot ons, maar wij verwierpen hem, en zeiden: "God heeft niets geopenbaard; gij verkeert slechts in grote dwaling."
null.verse 67:10: En zij zullen zeggen: "Indien wij maar geluisterd hadden en ons verstand hadden gebruikt, zouden wij ons niet onder de bewonerg van het laaiende Vuur bevinden."
null.verse 67:11: Dan zullen zij hun zonden bekennen; maar de bewoners van het Vuur zijn verre (van genade).
null.verse 67:12: Waarlijk, degenen die hun Heer in het verborgene vrezen, zullen vergiffenis en een grote beloning ontvangen.
null.verse 67:13: Hetzij gij uw woorden verbergt of openbaar maakt, Hij weet, wat in (uw) binnenste is.
null.verse 67:14: Zou Hij Die schiep niet alles weten? Hij is Aldoordringend, Alkennend.
null.verse 67:15: Hij is het Die de aarde aan u onderworpen heeft; wandelt dus op haar paden en geniet van haar gaven. En tot Hem zal de Opstanding zijn.
null.verse 67:16: Voelt gij u veilig voor Hem Die in de Hemel is, dat Hij u niet zal doen verzwelgen als de aarde plotseling begint te schudden?
null.verse 67:17: Voelt gij u veilig voor Hem Die in de Hemel is, dat Hij niet tegen u een orkaan zal zenden? Dan zult gij weten, hoe (mijn) waarschuwing was.
null.verse 67:18: En voorzeker loochenden zij die vóór u waren ook (de boodschap). Hoe (ernstig) was dan Mijn afkeuring!
null.verse 67:19: Hebben zij de vogelen niet boven hun (hoofden) gezien, die hun vleugels uitspreiden en in- eenvouwen? Niemand behalve de Barmhartige houdt ze tegen, waarlijk, Hij ziet alle dingen.
null.verse 67:20: Waar is uw leger dat u buiten God om zou kunnen helpen? De ongelovigen zijn omhuld door bedrog.
null.verse 67:21: Of wie is er die voor u wil zorgen indien Hij Zijn voorziening terughoudt? Neen, zij volharden in opstandigheid en afkerigheid.
null.verse 67:22: Is hij die gebogen loopt, beter geleid of hij die rechtop het rechte pad bewandelt?
null.verse 67:23: Zeg: "Hij is het, Die u schiep, en u oren, ogen en hart gaf; weinig dank betuigt gij er voor."
null.verse 67:24: Zeg: "Hij is het Die u vermenigvuldigt op aarde en tot Hem zult gij bijeen verzameld worden."
null.verse 67:25: En zij zeggen: "Wanneer zal deze belofte vervuld worden, als gij de waarheid spreekt?"
null.verse 67:26: Zeg: "De kennis daarvan ligt alleen bij God en ik ben slechts een duideliike waarschuwer."
null.verse 67:27: Maar als zij de straf van nabij zullen zien, zal het gezicht der ongelovigen zich verduisteren en er zal gezegd worden: "Dit is wat gij placht te vragen."
null.verse 67:28: Zeg: "Vertel mij, indien God mij en degenen die met mij zijn, zou vernietigen - veeleer zal Hij ons genadig zijn - wie zal de ongelovigen tegen een pijnlijke straf kunnen beschermen?"
null.verse 67:29: Zeg: "Hij is de Barmhartige, in Hem geloven wij en in Hem stellen wij ons vertrouwen. En gij zult weldra weten wie in klaarblijkelijke dwaling verkeert."
null.verse 67:30: Zeg: "Vertel mij, indien uw water diep in de aarde wegzakt, wie zal u dan helder stromend water kunnen brengen?"

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 67:1: Blessed is He in Whose hand is the Sovereignty, and, He is Able to do all things.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 67:2: Who hath created life and death that He may try you which of you is best in conduct; and He is the Mighty, the Forgiving,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 67:3: Who hath created seven heavens in harmony. Thou (Muhammad) canst see no fault in the Beneficent One’s creation; then look again: Canst thou see any rifts ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 67:4: Then look again and yet again, thy sight will return unto thee weakened and made dim.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 67:5: And verily We have beautified the world’s heaven with lamps, and We have made them missiles for the devils, and for them We have prepared the doom of flame.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 67:6: And for those who disbelieve in their Lord there is the doom of hell, a hapless journey’s end!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 67:7: When they are flung therein they hear its roaring as it boileth up,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 67:8: As it would burst with rage. Whenever a (fresh) host is flung therein the wardens thereof ask them: Came there unto you no warner ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 67:9: They say: Yea, verily, a warner came unto us; but we denied and said: Allah hath naught revealed; ye are in naught but a great error.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 67:10: And they say: Had we been wont to listen or have sense, we had not been among the dwellers in the flames.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 67:11: So they acknowledge their sins; but far removed (from mercy) are the dwellers in the flames.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 67:12: Lo! those who fear their Lord in secret, theirs will be forgiveness and a great reward.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 67:13: And keep your opinion secret or proclaim it, lo! He is Knower of all that is in the breasts (of men).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 67:14: Should He not know what He created ? And He is the Subtile, the Aware.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 67:15: He it is Who hath made the earth subservient unto you, so Walk in the paths thereof and eat of His providence. And unto Him will be the resurrection (of the dead).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 67:16: Have ye taken security from Him Who is in the heaven that He will not cause the earth to swallow you when lo! it is convulsed ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 67:17: Or have ye taken security from Him Who is in the heaven that He will not let loose on you a hurricane ? But ye shall know the manner of My warning.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 67:18: And verily those before them denied, then (see) the manner of My wrath (with them)!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 67:19: Have they not seen the birds above them spreading out their wings and closing them ? Naught upholdeth them save the Beneficent. Lo! He is Seer of all things.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 67:20: Or who is he that will be an army unto you to help you instead of the Beneficent ? The disbelievers are in naught but illusion.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 67:21: Or who is he that will provide for you if He should withhold His providence ? Nay, but they are set in pride and frowardness.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 67:22: Is he who goeth groping on his face more rightly guided, or he who walketh upright on a straight road ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 67:23: Say (unto them, O Muhammad): He it is who gave you being, and hath assigned unto you ears and eyes and hearts. Small thanks give ye!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 67:24: Say: He it is Who multiplieth you in the earth, and unto Whom ye will be gathered.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 67:25: And they say: When (will) this promise (be fulfilled), if ye are truthful ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 67:26: Say: The knowledge is with Allah only, and I am but a plain warner;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 67:27: But when they see it nigh, the faces of those who disbelieve will be awry, and it will be said (unto them): This is that for which ye used to call.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 67:28: Say (O Muhammad): Have ye thought: Whether Allah causeth me (Muhammad) and those with me to perish or hath mercy on us, still, who will protect the disbelievers from a painful doom ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 67:29: Say: He is the Beneficent. In Him we believe and in Him we put our trust. And ye will soon know who it is that is in error manifest.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 67:30: Say: Have ye thought: If (all) your water were to disappear into the earth, who then could bring you gushing water ?

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 67:1: Blessed be He in Whose hands is Dominion; and He over all things hath Power;-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 67:2: He Who created Death and Life, that He may try which of you is best in deed: and He is the Exalted in Might, Oft-Forgiving;-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 67:3: He Who created the seven heavens one above another: No want of proportion wilt thou see in the Creation of (God) Most Gracious. So turn thy vision again: seest thou any flaw?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 67:4: Again turn thy vision a second time: (thy) vision will come back to thee dull and discomfited, in a state worn out.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 67:5: And we have, (from of old), adorned the lowest heaven with Lamps, and We have made such (Lamps) (as) missiles to drive away the Evil Ones, and have prepared for them the Penalty of the Blazing Fire.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 67:6: For those who reject their Lord (and Cherisher) is the Penalty of Hell: and evil is (such), Destination.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 67:7: When they are cast therein, they will hear the (terrible) drawing in of its breath even as it blazes forth,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 67:8: Almost bursting with fury: Every time a Group is cast therein, its Keepers will ask, "Did no Warner come to you?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 67:9: They will say: "Yes indeed; a Warner did come to us, but we rejected him and said, ’God never sent down any (Message): ye are nothing but an egregious delusion!’"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 67:10: They will further say: "Had we but listened or used our intelligence, we should not (now) be among the Companions of the Blazing Fire!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 67:11: They will then confess their sins: but far will be (Forgiveness) from the Companions of the Blazing Fire!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 67:12: As for those who fear their Lord unseen, for them is Forgiveness and a great Reward.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 67:13: And whether ye hide your word or publish it, He certainly has (full) knowledge, of the secrets of (all) hearts.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 67:14: Should He not know,- He that created? and He is the One that understands the finest mysteries (and) is well-acquainted (with them).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 67:15: It is He Who has made the earth manageable for you, so traverse ye through its tracts and enjoy of the Sustenance which He furnishes: but unto Him is the Resurrection.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 67:16: Do ye feel secure that He Who is in heaven will not cause you to be swallowed up by the earth when it shakes (as in an earthquake)?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 67:17: Or do ye feel secure that He Who is in Heaven will not send against you a violent tornado (with showers of stones), so that ye shall know how (terrible) was My warning?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 67:18: But indeed men before them rejected (My warning): then how (terrible) was My rejection (of them)?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 67:19: Do they not observe the birds above them, spreading their wings and folding them in? None can uphold them except (God) Most Gracious: Truly (God) Most Gracious: Truly it is He that watches over all things.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 67:20: Nay, who is there that can help you, (even as) an army, besides (God) Most Merciful? In nothing but delusion are the Unbelievers.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 67:21: Or who is there that can provide you with Sustenance if He were to withhold His provision? Nay, they obstinately persist in insolent impiety and flight (from the Truth).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 67:22: Is then one who walks headlong, with his face grovelling, better guided,- or one who walks evenly on a Straight Way?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 67:23: Say: "It is He Who has created you (and made you grow), and made for you the faculties of hearing, seeing, feeling and understanding: little thanks it is ye give.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 67:24: Say: "It is He Who has multiplied you through the earth, and to Him shall ye be gathered together."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 67:25: They ask: When will this promise be (fulfilled)? - If ye are telling the truth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 67:26: Say: "As to the knowledge of the time, it is with God alone: I am (sent) only to warn plainly in public."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 67:27: At length, when they see it close at hand, grieved will be the faces of the Unbelievers, and it will be said (to them): "This is (the promise fulfilled), which ye were calling for!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 67:28: Say: "See ye?- If God were to destroy me, and those with me, or if He bestows His Mercy on us,- yet who can deliver the Unbelievers from a grievous Penalty?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 67:29: Say: "He is (God) Most Gracious: We have believed in Him, and on Him have we put our trust: So, soon will ye know which (of us) it is that is in manifest error."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 67:30: Say: "See ye?- If your stream be some morning lost (in the underground earth), who then can supply you with clear-flowing water?"

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 67:1: Blessed be He in whose hand is the Kingdom -- He is powerful over everything --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 67:2: who created death and life, that He might try you which of you is fairest in works; and He is the All-mighty, the All-forgiving --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 67:3: who created seven heavens one upon another. Thou seest not in the creation of the All-merciful any imperfection. Return thy gaze; seest thou any fissure?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 67:4: Then return thy gaze again, and again, and thy gaze comes back to thee dazzled, aweary.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 67:5: And We adorned the lower heaven with lamps, and made them things to stone Satans; and We have prepared for them the chastisement of the Blaze.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 67:6: And for those who disbelieve in their Lord there awaits the chastisement of Gehenna -- an evil homecoming!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 67:7: When they are cast into it they will hear it sighing, the while it boils
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 67:8: and wellnigh bursts asunder with rage. As often as a troop is cast into it, its keepers ask them, ’Came there no warner to you?’;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 67:9: They say, ’Yes indeed, a warner came to us; but we cried lies, saying, "God has not sent down anything; you are only in great error.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 67:10: They also say, ’If we had only heard, or had understood, we would not have been of the inhabitants of the Blaze.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 67:11: So they confess their sins. Curse the inhabitants of the Blaze!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 67:12: Surely those who fear their Lord in the Unseen -- there awaits them forgiveness and a great wage.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 67:13: Be secret in your speech, or proclaim it, He knows the thoughts within the breasts.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 67:14: Shall He not know, who created? And He is the All-subtle, the All-aware.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 67:15: It is He who made the earth submissive to you; therefore walk in its tracts, and eat of His provision; to Him is the Uprising.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 67:16: Do you feel secure that He who is in heaven will not cause the earth to swallow you, the while it rocks?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 67:17: Do you feel secure that He who is in heaven will not loose against you a squall of pebbles, then you shall know how My warning is?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 67:18: Those that were before them also cried lies; then how was My horror!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 67:19: Have they not regarded the birds above them spreading their wings, and closing them? Naught holds them but the All-merciful. Surely He sees everything.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 67:20: Or who is this that shall be a host for you to help you, apart from the All-merciful? The unbelievers are only in delusion.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 67:21: Or who is this that shall provide for you if He withholds His provision? No, but they persist in disdain and aversion.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 67:22: What, is he who walks prone upon his face better guided than he who walks upright on a straight path?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 67:23: Say: ’It is He who produced you, and appointed for you hearing and sight and hearts; little thanks you show!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 67:24: Say: ’It is He who scattered you in the earth, and unto Him you shall be mustered.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 67:25: They say, ’When shall this promise come to pass, if you speak truly?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 67:26: Say: ’The knowledge is with God; I am only a clear warner.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 67:27: Then, when they see it nigh at hand, the faces of the unbelievers will be vexed, and it will be said, ’This is what you were promised.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 67:28: Say: ’What think you? If God destroys me and those with me, or has mercy on us, then who will protect the unbelievers from a painful chastisement?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 67:29: Say: ’He is the All-merciful. We believe in Him, and in Him we put all our trust. Assuredly, you will soon, know who is in manifest error.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 67:30: Say: ’What think you? If in the morning your water should have vanished into the earth, then who would bring you running water?’

Muhammad Asad.verse 67:1: HALLOWED be He in whose hand all dominion rests, since He has the power to will anything:
Muhammad Asad.verse 67:2: He who has created death as well as life, so that He might put you to a test [and thus show] which of you is best in conduct, and [make you realize that] He alone is almighty, truly forgiving.
Muhammad Asad.verse 67:3: [Hallowed be] He who has created seven heavens in full harmony with one another: no fault wilt thou see in the creation of the Most Gracious. And turn thy vision [upon it] once more: canst thou see any flaw?
Muhammad Asad.verse 67:4: Yea, turn thy vision [upon it] again and yet again: [and every time] thy vision will fall back upon thee, dazzled and truly defeated....
Muhammad Asad.verse 67:5: And, indeed, We have adorned the skies nearest to the earth with lights, and have made them the object of futile guesses for the evil ones [from among men]: and for them have We readied suffering through a blazing flame
Muhammad Asad.verse 67:6: for suffering in hell awaits all who are [thus] bent on blaspheming against their Sustainer: and how vile a journey’s end!
Muhammad Asad.verse 67:7: When they are cast into that [hell], they will hear its breath indrawing as it boils up,
Muhammad Asad.verse 67:8: well-nigh bursting with fury; [and] every time a host [of such sinners] is flung into it, its keepers will ask them, "Has no warner ever come to you?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 67:9: They will reply: "Yea, a warner did indeed come unto us, but we gave him the lie and said, ‘Never has God sent down anything [by way of revelation]! You [self-styled warners] are but lost in a great delusion!’"
Muhammad Asad.verse 67:10: And they will add: "Had we but listened [to those warnings], or [at least] used our own reason, we would not [now] be among those who are destined for the blazing flame!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 67:11: Thus will they come to realize their sins: but [by that time,] remote will have become all good from those who are destined for the blazing flame.
Muhammad Asad.verse 67:12: [As against this,] behold, for those who stand in awe of their Sustainer although He is beyond the reach of their perception, there is forgiveness in store and a great reward.
Muhammad Asad.verse 67:13: AND [know, O men, that] whether you keep your beliefs secret or state them openly, He has full knowledge indeed of all that is in [your] hearts.
Muhammad Asad.verse 67:14: How could it be that He who has created [all] should not know [all]? Yea, He alone is unfathomable [in His wisdom], all-aware!
Muhammad Asad.verse 67:15: He it is who has made the earth easy to live upon: go about, then, in all its regions, and partake of the sustenance which He provides: but [always bear in mind that] unto Him you shall be resurrected.
Muhammad Asad.verse 67:16: Can you ever feel secure that He who is in heaven will not cause the earth to swallow you up when, lo and behold, it begins to quake?
Muhammad Asad.verse 67:17: Or can you ever feel secure that He who is in heaven will not let loose against you a deadly stormwind, whereupon you would come to know how [true] My warning was?
Muhammad Asad.verse 67:18: And, indeed, [many of] those who lived aforetime did give the lie [to My warnings]: and how awesome was My rejection [of them]!
Muhammad Asad.verse 67:19: Have they, then, never beheld the birds above them, spreading their wings and drawing them in? None but the Most Gracious upholds them: for, verily, He keeps all things in His sight.
Muhammad Asad.verse 67:20: [And] is there any, beside the Most Gracious, that could be a shield for you, and succour you [against danger]? They who deny this truth are but lost in self-delusion!
Muhammad Asad.verse 67:21: Or is there any that could provide you with sustenance if He should withhold His provision [from you]? Nay, but they [who are bent on denying the truth] stubbornly persist in their disdain [of God’s messages] and in their headlong flight [from Him]!
Muhammad Asad.verse 67:22: But then, is he that goes along with his face close to the ground better guided than he that walks upright on a straight way?
Muhammad Asad.verse 67:23: SAY: "[God is] He who has brought you [all] into being, and has endowed you with hearing, and sight, and hearts: [yet] how seldom are you grateful!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 67:24: Say: "It is He who has multiplied you on earth; and it is unto Him that you shall be gathered [on resurrection]."
Muhammad Asad.verse 67:25: But they [only] ask, "When is this promise to be fulfilled? [Answer this, O you who believe in it,] if you are men of truth!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 67:26: Say thou, [O Prophet:] "Knowledge thereof rests with God alone; and I am only a plain warner."
Muhammad Asad.verse 67:27: Yet in the end, when they shall see that [fulfilment] close at hand, the faces of those who were bent on denying the truth will be stricken with grief; and they will be told, "This it is that you were [so derisively] calling for!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 67:28: SAY [O Prophet]: "What do you think? Whether God destroys me and those who follow me, or graces us with His mercy – is there anyone that could protect [you] deniers of the truth from grievous suffering [in the life to come]?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 67:29: Say: "He is the Most Gracious: we have attained to faith in Him, and in Him have we placed our trust; and in time you will come to know which of us was lost in manifest error."
Muhammad Asad.verse 67:30: Say [unto those who deny the truth]: "What do you think? If of a sudden all your water were to vanish underground, who [but God] could provide you with water from [new] unsullied springs?"

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 67:1: Glorious is the One in whose hand is the Kingdom (of the whole universe), and He is powerful over every thing,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 67:2: the One who created death and life, so that He may test you as to which of you is better in his deeds. And He is the All-Mighty, the Most-Forgiving,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 67:3: who has created seven skies, one over the other. You will see nothing out of proportion in the creation of the RaHmān (the All-Merciful Allah). So, cast your eye again. Do you see any rifts?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 67:4: Then cast your eye again and again, and the eye will come back to you abased, in a state of weariness.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 67:5: And We have decorated the nearest sky with lamps, and have made them devices to stone the devils, and We have prepared for them the punishment of Hell.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 67:6: And for those who disbelieved in their Lord, there is the punishment of Jahannam , and it is an evil end.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 67:7: When they will be thrown in it, they will hear a terrible sound from it, and it will be boiling,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 67:8: seeming as if it will burst out of fury. Whenever a group is thrown into it, its keepers will say to them, “Had no warner come to you?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 67:9: They will say, “Yes, a warner had come to us, but We had rejected, and said, ‘Allah has not revealed anything. You are only in great error.’”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 67:10: And they will say, “Had we been listening or understanding, we would not have been among the people of the Hell.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 67:11: Thus they will confess their sin. So, away with the people of the Hell!
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 67:12: Surely, for those who have awe of their Lord without seeing (Him), there is forgiveness and a big reward.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 67:13: Whether you keep your talk secret or make it aloud, He knows well what lies in the hearts.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 67:14: Is it (imaginable) that He who has created (them) will not have (such a) knowledge, while He is the Knower of the finest things, the All-Aware?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 67:15: He is the One who has made the earth subjugated for you, so walk on its shoulders, and eat out of His provision, and to Him is the Resurrection.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 67:16: Have you become fearless of Him who is in the sky if He makes you sink into the earth, and it starts trembling at once?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 67:17: Or, have you become fearless of Him who is in the sky if He looses a violent wind with stones against you? So, you will soon come to know how was My warning!
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 67:18: And of course, those before them (also) rejected (the truth). So, how was My censure?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 67:19: Have they not looked to the birds above them spreading their wings, and (at times) they fold (them) in? No one holds them up except the RaHmān (the All-Merciful Allah). Surely He is watchful of every thing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 67:20: Now, who is there to act as a force for you to help you, except the RaHmān ? The disbelievers are in nothing but delusion.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 67:21: Or, who is there to give you sustenance, if He withholds His sustenance? Still, they persist in rebellion and aversion.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 67:22: Then, is the one who walks falling down (frequently) on his face more right or the one who walks properly on a straight path?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 67:23: Say, “He is the One who has originated you, and made for you ears and eyes and hearts. How little you pay gratitude!”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 67:24: Say, “He is the One who has scattered you on the earth, and to Him you will be assembled.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 67:25: And they say, “When will this promise (of the Day of Judgment) be fulfilled, if you are true?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 67:26: Say, “The knowledge (of that Day) is only with Allah, and I am only a plain warner.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 67:27: Then, once they will see it approaching, the faces of the disbelievers will be turned awkward, and it will be said, “This is what you were calling for!”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 67:28: Say, “Tell me, if Allah destroys me and those who are with me (as you wish), or has mercy on us (as we wish), who can (in either case) save the disbelievers from a painful punishment?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 67:29: Say, “He is the RaHmān; we have believed in Him, and in Him we placed our trust. So, you will soon come to know who is in open error.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 67:30: Say, “Tell me, Should your water vanish into the earth, who will bring you a flowing (stream of) water?

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 67:1: Blessed is He in Whose hand is [all] sovereignty, and He has power over all things.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 67:2: [He] Who created death and life, that He may try you [to see] which of you is best in conduct, and He is the Mighty, the Forgiving,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 67:3: Who created seven heavens in layers. You do not see in the Compassionate One’s creation any irregularity. Then cast your eyes again: Do you see any fissure?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 67:4: Then cast your eyes yet again and your sight will return to you humbled and wearied.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 67:5: And verily We have adorned the lowest heaven with lamps, and made them missiles against the devils; and We have prepared for them the chastisement of the Blaze.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 67:6: And for those who disbelieve in their Lord there is the chastisement of Hell, and [what] an evil journey’s end!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 67:7: When they are flung into it they hear it blaring as it seethes,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 67:8: almost exploding with rage. Whenever a host is flung into it, its keepers ask them: ‘Did there not come to you a warner?’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 67:9: They will say, ‘Yes, a warner did indeed come to us, but we denied and said, “God has not revealed anything; you are assuredly in great error” ’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 67:10: And they will say, ‘Had we listened or comprehended, we would not have been among the inhabitants of the Blaze’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 67:11: Thus they will confess their sin. So away with the inhabitants of the Blaze!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 67:12: Assuredly those who fear their Lord in secret, there will be for them forgiveness and a great reward.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 67:13: And [whether you] keep secret your speech or proclaim it, He indeed is Knower of what is in the breasts.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 67:14: Will He Who has created not know? And He is the Subtle, the Aware.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 67:15: It is He Who made the earth tractable for you, so walk in its flanks and eat of His provision; and to Him is the resurrection.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 67:16: Are you secure [in thinking] that He Who is in the heaven will not cause the earth to swallow you while it quakes?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 67:17: Are you secure [in thinking] that He Who is in the heaven will not unleash upon you a squall of pebbles? But you will [soon] come to know the nature of My warning.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 67:18: And verily those who were before them denied, then [see] how was My rebuttal!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 67:19: Or have they not seen the birds above them spreading their wings and closing? Nothing sustains them, except the Compassionate One. Indeed He is Seer of all things.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 67:20: Or who is it that will be an army for you to help you besides the Compassionate One? The disbelievers are in nothing but delusion.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 67:21: Or who is it that will provide for you if He withholds His provision? Nay, but they persist in disdain and aversion.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 67:22: Is he who walks cast down on his face more rightly guided, or he who walks upright on a straight path?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 67:23: Say: ‘It is He Who created you and endowed you with hearing and sight and hearts. Little do you thank!’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 67:24: Say: ‘It is He Who multiplied you on earth, and to Him you will be gathered’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 67:25: And they say: ‘When will this promise be [fulfilled], if you are truthful?’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 67:26: Say: ‘The knowledge is only with God, and I am but a plain warner’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 67:27: But when they see it near at hand, the faces of those who disbelieved will be awry, and it will be said: ‘This is that which you used to make claims about’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 67:28: Say: ‘Have you considered: If God destroys me and those with me, or has mercy on us, who then will protect the disbelievers from a painful chastisement?’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 67:29: Say: ‘He is the Compassionate One; we believe in Him, and in Him we put our trust. And assuredly you will [soon] know who is in manifest error’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 67:30: Say: ‘Have you considered: If your water were to sink deep into the earth, who then will bring you running water?’

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 67:1: Blessed is He in Whose (Mighty) Hand is the kingdom (of all the worlds). And He enjoys perfect command over everything;
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 67:2: He Who has created death and life (so that) He may test you as to which of you is best in conduct. And He is Almighty, Most Forgiving;
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 67:3: He Who has created seven (or numerous) heavenly spheres corresponding to one another (layer upon layer). You will not find any irregularity and disproportion in the system of the creation of the Most Kind (Lord). So have a (meditative and thoughtful) look around: do you find in this (creation) any incongruity or disharmony (i.e., degeneration or falling apart)?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 67:4: Look around time and again with (an inquisitive) vision (from different angles and with scientific methods. Every time) your sight will return to you fatigued and frustrated (in finding any shortcoming or imperfection).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 67:5: And surely, We have adorned the lowest heaven of the universe with lights (in the form of stars, planets, other asteroids and meteoroids). And We have also made (some of them) the means of pelting away (i.e., eliminating the negative effects of) satans (i.e., rebellious forces). And We have prepared for these (satans) a torment of Blazing Fire.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 67:6: And for those who have denied their Lord is the torment of Hell. And what an evil abode it is!
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 67:7: When they will be flung into it, they will hear its horrifying roar. And that (Fire) will be boiling (with rage),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 67:8: As if it is about to burst into pieces with intense wrath. When a group will be cast into it, its guards will ask them: ‘Did no Warner come to you?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 67:9: They will say: ‘Yes indeed! A Warner did come to us, but we rejected him and said: Allah has not sent down anything. You are just in great error.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 67:10: And they will say: ‘Had we listened to or understood (the truth), we would not have been (put) amongst the inmates of Hell (Today).’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 67:11: Then they will confess their sin. So remoteness for the inmates of Hell (from Allah’s mercy) is (destined).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 67:12: Surely, those who fear their Lord unseen, for them is forgiveness and great reward.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 67:13: And whether you speak in secret or aloud, certainly He knows best (even) the things (hidden) in the hearts.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 67:14: Does He, Who has created, not know? In truth, He is the One Who can see the essence and is Well Aware (of everything).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 67:15: He is the One Who has made the earth soft and subservient to you. So walk about through its tracks and eat of the sustenance (given) by Him, and towards Him alone is the return, rising (after death).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 67:16: Have you gone fearless of (the Lord of) the heaven that He may sink you into the earth when it suddenly shakes?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 67:17: Have you gone fearless of (the Lord of) the heaven that He may send against you a stone-pelting wind? Then soon will you come to know how My Warning is!
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 67:18: And surely, those before them (also) denied. But how (awful) proved My denial!
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 67:19: Have they not seen the birds above them spreading out their wings and (sometimes) folding them? Nothing can hold them (from falling) except (the law made by) the Most Kind (Lord). Surely, He sees everything best.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 67:20: Well, is there anyone that can muster an army to help you against the Most Kind Lord? The disbelievers are merely (snared) in deception.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 67:21: Well, is there anyone that can provide you sustenance if (Allah) holds back His sustenance (from you)? In fact, they are adamantly fixed in rebellion and hatred (for truth).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 67:22: Is he who walks in prone position more rightly guided, or he who walks upright on a straight path?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 67:23: Say: ‘(Allah) is He Who created you and provided you with ears and eyes and hearts. Yet you give thanks but little.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 67:24: Say: ‘He is the One Who has spread you in the earth, and you will be gathered towards Him (on the Day of Assembly).’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 67:25: And they say: ‘When will this promise (of the Day of Resurrection) be fulfilled if you are truthful?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 67:26: Say: ‘The knowledge (of that Hour) is with Allah alone and I am just a clear Warner.’ (If the time is disclosed, there will be no fear any more.)
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 67:27: Then, when they will see that (Day) near, the faces of the disbelievers will be deformed and darkened, and it will be said (to them): ‘This is (the promise) which you asked for (to come to pass in haste).’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 67:28: Say: ‘Well, give your view: if Allah causes me death (as you desire) and (also) to my Companions, or shows mercy to us (i.e., defers our death), then (in both these cases) who will shelter the disbelievers from the painful torment?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 67:29: Say: ‘He alone is the Most Kind (Lord) in Whom we believe and in Whom we trust. So you will soon know who is in open error.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 67:30: Say: ‘If your water sinks far deep into the earth (i.e., dries up), then who will bring you flowing water (on earth)?’

null.verse 67:1: Siunattu on Hän, jonka käsissä on valtakunta ja voima yli kaiken olevaisen!
null.verse 67:2: Hän, joka loi elämän ja kuoleman koetellakseen, kuka teistä osoittautuu parhaaksi teoissa. Hän on mahtava, laupias.
null.verse 67:3: Hän on luonut seitsemän taivasta toinen toisensa yläpuolelle. Et voi havaita mitään vikaa Armahtajan luomistyössä. Katsele ympärillesi: voitko huomata mitään vajavaisuutta?
null.verse 67:4: Käänny ylt'ympäri ja katsele yhä edelleen, ja katseesi palaa lähtökohtaan pettyneenä ja väsyneenä.
null.verse 67:5: Olemmehan koristanut koko alimman taivaan valoilla, joista on tullut aseita paholaisia vastaan, näille Me olemme valmistanut helvetin tulen tuskat.
null.verse 67:6: Niitä, jotka eivät usko Herraansa, odottaa helvetin tuska; kurja on tuo määränpää.
null.verse 67:7: Kun heidät heitetään sinne, he kuulevat sen pauhun, kun se kiehuu.
null.verse 67:8: Se on raivoonsa pakahtumaisillaan. Joka kerta, kun sinne heitetään joukko, sen vartijat kysyvät näiltä: »Eikö varoittaja aikanaan tullut luoksenne?»
null.verse 67:9: Ja he vastaavat: »Kyllä, varoittaja tuli totisesti luoksemme, mutta me torjuimme hänet ja sanoimme: 'Jumala ei ole sinulle ilmoitustaan antanut, olet suuressa harhassa.'»
null.verse 67:10: Ja he sanovat: »Jos olisimme ottaneet vaarin ja miettineet, emme olisi joutuneet helvetin asukkaiden joukkoon.»
null.verse 67:11: Niin he tunnustavat syntinsä, mutta etäälle armosta jäävät helvetin tulen asukkaat.
null.verse 67:12: Niitä varten, jotka salassakin pelkäävät ja kunnioittavat Herraansa, on anteeksiantamus ja suuri palkinto.
null.verse 67:13: Joko salaatte sanottavanne tai lausutte sen julki, kyllä Herra varmasti tuntee mielenne.
null.verse 67:14: Eikö Hän sitä tietäisi, joka kaiken loi? Hänhän vähimmänkin havaitsee ja kaiken tajuaa.
null.verse 67:15: Hän on luonut maan alamaiseksenne, jotta voisitte kävellä sen teillä ja syödä sen antimia. Hänen luokseen johtaa ylösnousemus.
null.verse 67:16: Oletteko varmat siitä, ettei Hän, joka on yläpuolellanne, anna maan niellä teitä? Katso, se jo vavahtelee!
null.verse 67:17: Tai oletteko varmat siitä, ettei Hän, joka on teidän yläpuolellanne, lähetä päällenne hirmumyrskyä? Saatte kokea, millainen oli minun varoitukseni.
null.verse 67:18: On kyllä ollut niitä, jotka ennen heitä ovat väittäneet totuutta valheeksi, mutta millainen olikaan kuritukseni!
null.verse 67:19: Eivätkö he näe, miten linnut heidän yläpuolellaan levittävät ja kokoovat siipensä? Kuka muu kuin Armahtaja pitää niitä koholla? Hän totisesti näkee kaiken.
null.verse 67:20: Kuka muu kuin Armahtaja voi teitä auttaa niinkuin suuri sotajoukko? Epäuskoiset ovat sokeita.
null.verse 67:21: Onko ketään, joka teitä ravitsisi, jos Hän ei antaisi teille elatusta? Mutta he vain jatkavat kapinoimistaan ja vastusteluaan.
null.verse 67:22: Kumpi voi paremmin seurata johdatusta, sekö, joka ryömii kasvot maata vasten, vai se, joka etenee oikeata tietä pystyssä päin?
null.verse 67:23: Sano: »Hän on teidät luonut ja antanut teille näön, kuulon ja sydämen. Vähäinen on teidän kiitollisuutenne.»
null.verse 67:24: Sano: »Hän on teidät levittänyt aina maan ääriin asti, ja Hänen luokseen teidät kootaan yhteen.»
null.verse 67:25: He sanovat myös: »Milloin on tämä lupaus täyttyvä, jos puheesi on totta?»
null.verse 67:26: Sano: »Sen tietää Jumala yksin, minä olen vain julkinen varoittaja.»
null.verse 67:27: Mutta kun he näkevät tuhon olevan lähellä, synkkenevät niiden kasvot, jatka eivät usko, ja kuuluu sana: »Tämä on se, mitä te halusitte.»
null.verse 67:28: Sano: »Mitä ajattelette? Vaikkapa Jumala tuhoaisi minut ja ne, jotka ovat minun kanssani, tai armahtaisi meidät, kukapa silloinkaan pelastaisi epäuskoiset tuomion kurituksesta?»
null.verse 67:29: Sano: »Hän on Armahtaja, Me uskomme Häneen ja Häneen Me luotamme; pian saatte tietää, kuka on ilmeisessä harhassa.»
null.verse 67:30: Sano: »Mitä ajattelisitte, jos jonakin aamuna vetenne valuisi kuiviin? Kuka teille silloin voisi hankkia kirkasta, juoksevaa vettä?»

Jean-Louis Michon.verse 67:1: Béni soit Celui qui tient en Sa main le Royaume et qui est puissant sur toute chose !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 67:2: Celui qui a créé la mort et la vie pour vous éprouver [et voir] qui de vous agit le mieux, et qui est l'Omnipotent, le Pardonneur.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 67:3: Celui qui a créé sept cieux bien ordonnés. Tu ne vois dans la création du Miséricordieux aucune faille. Regarde encore ! Aperçois-tu quelque brèche ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 67:4: Puis, regarde encore par deux fois : ton regard reviendra vers toi, lassé, brouillé.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 67:5: Nous avons orné le ciel de ce monde de luminaires et Nous en avons fait des projectiles contre les démons, et Nous avons préparé pour eux le châtiment de la Fournaise.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 67:6: A ceux qui ont mécru en leur Seigneur est destiné le châtiment de la Géhenne. Quel détestable lieu de retour !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 67:7: Quand ils y sont jetés, ils l'entendent rugir tandis qu'elle bouillonne. Elle est près
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 67:8: d'éclater de fureur. Chaque fois qu'un groupe y est précipité, ses gardiens lui demandent : " Un avertisseur n'est-il pas venu à vous ? "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 67:9: " Si fait ! disent-ils, un avertisseur est venu à nous, mais nous avons crié au mensonge et nous avons dit : "Dieu n'a rien fait descendre ; c'est seulement que vous êtes plongés dans un profond égarement" ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 67:10: Ils ajoutent : " Si nous avions entendu ou si nous avions raisonné, nous ne serions pas parmi les hôtes de la Fournaise. "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 67:11: Ils reconnaissent leurs péchés. Que soient donc exterminés les hôtes de la Fournaise.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 67:12: Ceux qui craignent leur Seigneur en secret obtiendront un pardon et une grande récompense.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 67:13: Que vous teniez secret votre discours ou que vous le proclamiez, Dieu sait parfaitement ce que contiennent les poitrines.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 67:14: Ne connaît-Il pas ce qu'Il a créé, Lui qui est le Subtil, Celui qui est instruit de tout ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 67:15: C'est Lui qui a fait que la terre vous est soumise ; parcourez-en donc les vastes étendues et mangez de la subsistance que Dieu vous accorde. C'est vers Lui que se fera la Résurrection.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 67:16: Avez-vous obtenu de Celui qui est au ciel l'assurance qu'Il ne vous fera pas engloutir par la terre ? Or, voici qu'elle tremble...
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 67:17: Avez-vous obtenu de Celui qui est au ciel l'assurance qu'Il ne déchaînera pas contre vous une tornade ? Vous connaîtrez alors la nature de Mon avertissement.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 67:18: Ceux qui vécurent avant eux avaient crié au mensonge. Quelle ne fut pas alors Ma réprobation !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 67:19: Ne voient-il pas comment les oiseaux, au-dessus d'eux, déploient leurs ailes et les replient ? Seul le Miséricordieux les soutient ; en vérité, Il voit tout !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 67:20: Y a-t-il quelqu'un qui puisse, pour vous, faire office d'armée et vous secourir en lieu et place du Miséricordieux ? Certes, les mécréants ne sont que dans l'illusion.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 67:21: Quel est donc celui qui pourvoira à vos besoins si Dieu retient Ses dons ? Mais non !, ils persistent dans l'insolence et dans la haine.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 67:22: Celui qui marche tête baissée est-il mieux dirigé que celui qui marche tranquillement droit devant lui ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 67:23: Dis : " C'est Lui qui vous a fait exister et qui vous a donné l'ouïe, la vue et les cœurs. Comme vous êtes peu reconnaissants ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 67:24: Dis : " C'est Lui qui vous a multipliés sur la terre et vers Qui vous serez rassemblés ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 67:25: Ils disent : " Quand donc se réalisera cette promesse si vous êtes véridiques ? "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 67:26: Dis : " La connaissance n'est qu'auprès de Dieu, et moi je ne suis qu'un avertisseur explicite ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 67:27: Quand les mécréants verront le châtiment de près, leurs visages seront horrifiés. On leur dira :" Voici ce que vous réclamiez ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 67:28: Dis : " Y pensez-vous ? Soit que Dieu m'anéantisse, moi et mes compagnons, soit qu'Il me fasse miséricorde, qui donc protégera les mécréants contre un châtiment douloureux ? "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 67:29: Dis : " Lui, le Miséricordieux ! Nous croyons en Lui et à Lui nous nous en remettons ! Vous saurez bientôt qui se trouve dans un égarement manifeste ".
